romp.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to play in a noisy way, especially by running, jumping etc
romp.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: They could hear the children romping around upstairs.
romp.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to win a race, competition, election etc very easily
romp.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: In 1906 the Liberal Party romped back to power.
The women’s team romped to a 132–81 win over Ireland.
The favourite, Badawi, romped home in the first race.
romp.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a piece of amusing entertainment which has a lot of exciting scenes
romp.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: ‘A Royal Scandal’ is an hour-long romp that pokes fun at British royal marriages.
romp.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a period of sexual activity – used humorously, especially in newspapers
romp.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: when one sports team defeats another one very easily – used in newspapers
romp.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: the Yankees’ 12–1 romp over the Red Sox
